title: Coronavirus Updates & Information - St. Peter's Hospital
description: Safety remains Our Top Priority as We Begin Elective Surgeries & Procedures.
cleaned_text: Safety is one of our core values, and St. Peter's Health Partners is taking a thoughtful and careful approach to providing care. If you have been postponing care, we're here to help. [Call your doctor](/find-a-doctor/) today or try a virtual care alternative. It is safe to seek care. Learn more about our [commitment to your safety](/for-patients/safe-visits) St. Peter's Health Partners Emergency Departments are NOT public COVID testing sites. You should NOT come to the emergency department with mild COVID symptoms or for COVID testing. If you have serious symptoms like a high fever, trouble breathing, or chest pain, please call 9-1-1 or immediately go to the emergency department for care. Learn more about the similarities and differences between [COVID-19 and the Flu](https://www.cdc.gov/flu/symptoms/flu-vs-covid19.htm). "Maintaining a clean and safe enviornment for your care." If you have personal protective equipment (PPE) or other supplies that you would like to donate to help ensure the continued safety of the clinical care team, please email Peter Semenza at [peter.semenza@sphp.com](mailto:peter.semenza@sphp.com). Accepted items may include: We ask that all donated items be in usable condition, fully-boxed, within the expiration date, and made by a certified manufacturer. Thank you to all the individuals, businesses, and restaurants who have donated meals, drinks, snacks, and even gift cards to help our frontline staff! Every donation is greatly appreciated. If you'd like to coordinate food delivery or other donations, email Peter Semenza. Individuals who have fully recovered from COVID-19 can donate plasma to help treat current COVID-19 patients. If you think you may be eligible to donate, please visit [redcrossblood.org](https://www.redcrossblood.org/donate-blood/dlp/plasma-donations-from-recovered-covid-19-patients.html). Plasma donation will not only benefit patients from the Capital District but potentially those from other parts of the country. If you do not have any items to donate, but would still like to make a difference, you can make a monetary donation. Use the search feature below to access the Community Resource Hub - an online database for you to connect with free and reduced-cost health resources and social services both within our community and across all St. Peter's Health Partners and Trinity Health service locations. Type in a keyword like Transportation, Housing, or Food to find resources in your ZIP code.
